Defendant who challenges the stop of his white sedan by United States Border Patrol Agent Trevino, arguing that the factors known to Agent Trevino at the time of the stop fall short of reasonable suspicion
Defendant who contests the reasonableness of his initial traffic stop for failing to use a turn signal and argues it was pretextual, also contends that Officer Reyes exceeded the scope of a traffic stop, claimed the vehicle belonged to his aunt and then his cousin
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Law enforcement officer who performed the traffic stop on Ignacio Rodriguez's vehicle, inquired about the vehicle's ownership and travel plans, and issued a citation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent with nearly seven years of experience, including a year and a half at the Freer checkpoint, which has led him to recognize most vehicles passing down FM 2050, explained reasonable suspicion analysis during the hearing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hugo Benavides: United States Border Patrol Agent who conducted questioning and transported Ignacio Rodriguez to the checkpoint for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security who interviewed Ricardo and Ignacio Rodriguez, testified about the interview with Ignacio Rodriguez after he waived his Miranda rights
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.J. Scott Hacker: United States Magistrate Judge who is addressing the motions to suppress filed by the Defendants
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Santiago Hinojosa: Manager with the Hertz rental car company at the Laredo International Airport, testified about the registration of vehicles rented from different locations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Orona-Sanchez: Individual referenced in a court finding regarding alien smuggling using pickup trucks with camper shells
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRI: Defendants whose vehicles were stopped by law enforcement officers, and who were suspected of being involved in alien smuggling activities
